title: Can you please just revert Malzahar's rework?
body: I know this topic has been done to death but you really, really need to just accept that your precious rework was a complete and utter unmitigated disaster and just bring back old Malzahar so people can actually play him again.

replies.body: Riot only reverts reworks if the old champion was healthy. This isn't malzahar's case.

''Old malz was unhealthy'' is false meme by now. Its just assassin mains tears and Riot propaganda to excuse their shitty brogramming rework. People never had a problem with Old Malz and his 2% pickrate and literally zero changes aside some minion AI fixing for years. 

I mained Malz for like 5 years while being an usual forum goes, and let me tell you: Malz was never EVER a problem for the playerbase until all those ''I was abused by 30 Malz!! Toxic™! Unhealthy™! Binary™!'' bandwagoners came out of the woods on the wake of Malz rework.

> [{quoted}](name=Voluug13,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=XVbxGRNH,comment-id=00010004,timestamp=2017-04-22T23:21:11.660+0000)
>
> ''Old malz was unhealthy'' is false meme by now. Its just assassin mains tears and Riot propaganda. People never had a problem with Old Malz and his 2% pickrate and literally zero changes aside some minion AI fixing for years. 
> 
> I mained Malz for like 5 years while being an usual forum goes, and let me tell you: Malz was never EVER a problem for the playerbase until all those ''I was abused by 30 Malz!! Toxic™! Unhealthy™! Binary™!'' bandwagoners came out of the woods on the wake of Malz rework.

This basically sums it up.  Malz got one actual nerf that really comes to mind and it was to the damage on his purple puddle of pain waaaaaay back in, what, Season 2 I think?  A long time ago.  No one cared about Malz except his mains and then Riot utterly destroyed him.

The rework should be reverted.  Malz was perfectly fine.
HERE HERE!

> [{quoted}](name=Voluug13,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=XVbxGRNH,comment-id=00010004,timestamp=2017-04-22T23:21:11.660+0000)
>
> ''Old malz was unhealthy'' is false meme by now. Its just assassin mains tears and Riot propaganda. People never had a problem with Old Malz and his 2% pickrate and literally zero changes aside some minion AI fixing for years. 
> 
> I mained Malz for like 5 years while being an usual forum goes, and let me tell you: Malz was never EVER a problem for the playerbase until all those ''I was abused by 30 Malz!! Toxic™! Unhealthy™! Binary™!'' bandwagoners came out of the woods on the wake of Malz rework.

This.
vel koz 2 W and the minion waves is cleared faster
Tear through mana? Good thing I have this!  {{item:3802}}
Nearly all mages forget the concept of mana with that item.
But Malz didnt even need it. All he needed was double dorans and his E passive.

Correct; Vel'Koz has to almost eat the melee creeps to line up W on all of them. If multiple waves are stacked, he might not even be able to. 2 Void Rifts also take more time to cast than all of Malzahar's old kit combined.
Even as a talon main old malz wasn't bad for assassins.

good PvP is about creating a fair exchange between players with meaningful interactions and choices that reward good decision making and display of skill on both sides

player agency is important, counterplay is important, fun is important

100-0 someone who is on the same screen as you with an unavoidable point and click crowd control ability that prevents him from doing anything is not good PvP, it's not interesting, it's not fun, it's not fair, there is no exchange happening, there is no interaction between the 2 of you, there is no skill involved, it's terrible

if you like this kind of design, maybe PvP isn't for you, maybe you should play more PvE games, maybe you should invest in a punching bag to have a good time at your leisure, alone.

> player agency is important, counterplay is important, fun is important 

funny you mention these things, because these are all things which the reworked malzahar lacks. He has no way to counterplay, he has no agency, and i'd be lying if I said he was any fun (to play as or against).

You're assumption is that these player interactions occur in a 1v1 vacuum which they don't. There is far more counterplay to a 3 second delayed combo, than there is to a 1 second insta burst assassin. 
If you feel you couldn't rely on your team to implement this counterplay in the 5 or so second that it would take malz to 100-0 a target, then you could simply counter it yourself via {{item:3140}}... talk about player fucking agency.

They moved a lot of his power from his R to his other skills, he has a richer gameplay as a result and his all in burst pattern is much lower which creates more opportunities for his opponent to also play the game before of after he uses his R.

I'm also a bit surprised they kept the point and click suppression, but Malzahar is better off as a champion as he was before both for the players playing him and the players playing against him, literally all he did back then was QWE minions waves and QWER champions, he was braindead and unfair.

> hey moved a lot of his power from his R, Q, and E, to his W

Fixed it for you.

Man, you've clearly got no idea how old malz worked... If you're saying that malz would "iterally" QWE minion waves. I've got to wonder how often you even saw him played. 

Almost every mage, assassin, and fighter just QWER an enemy. There is always a braindead way to play a champion, that doesn't mean that way is optimal, and QWER (or basically comboing a single target) wasn't he optimal way to play malz either. 

He wasn't braindead, just your attempts to understand or play him are/were.

there was only one way to play malzahar and it was the optimal way since he had no other option

it's braindead because it is point and click and you can't mess up

it's unfair because there is no counterplay

????

I remember watching high diamond games back then in season 1-2, and there was a running joke going around where you had to type in all chat that you were going afk/multitasking/doing something else every time as malzahar as soon as you pressed R on someone and then followed a couple seconds later by "wait how did you die I was afk/doing something else" rofl. Malzahar was a meme, it was that silly

Yes, and then in the seasons 3-6 leading up the malzahar changes you saw... none of that.

> there was only one way to play malzahar and it was the optimal way since he had no other option

... wow i was just being mean, but you're actually that stupid... sorry, that was just intended to be an ad homonym not literal...

The best way to play malz was not to W,E, R combo. Maybe in the early game if the enemy tried to fight you 1v1, but he had no mobility and relatively low base move speed. 

Once you entered the mid game, and had constant team fights rather than 1v1s. There were a copule of optimal ways to play malz depending on your opponents and team. 

1) Q silence the burst mages and assassins to delay their damage and allow your team to get the initial lead in the fight. Use your W on the front line and E the focus target or lowest health (to make bounce more likely). The R was best used as targeted focus power or peel for a more fed carry. 

2) Q silence the tanks to prevent peeling of your assassins. W could be used as a zoning tool to split up the enemy back line from the front line or into two groups. E was too short range to reach the back line most of the time, so you'd normally throw it onto the squishiest front line to just get it doing damage, or hold it to for the first enemy to drop low. R could be used to hold the carry in place while the tanks are silenced, or on the tanks to allow your assassins to get in and kill the carries. 

Or some combination of those two.


Those are just the AP versions though. 

If it's an AD malz, then it's a lot more complex, but basically focus on voidling micro, W becomes a pure zoning tool, Q is still useful as a disruption though you want to be using it off CD. E is just a targeting tool for your voidlings, and you hold onto R until you've stacked your voidlings or to prevent a mobile enemy from disengaging.

> [{quoted}](name=XTRMN00B1337,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=XVbxGRNH,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2017-04-22T19:08:01.260+0000)
>
> Riot only reverts reworks if the old champion was healthy. This isn't malzahar's case.

New Malzahar isn't exactly the picture of game health either. He was HORRIBLY oppressive on release, and now pretty bad, even in his intended role (mostly due to all the nerfs he's received from being played outside that intended role)

I feel like it would be better to just revert it for the time being, until they can figure out what they want to do with him (they've made it clear they don't want him played outside of mid, they've even flat out said they don't like Malz support one bit), a revert will at least get him played in mid again.
I never said current malz isn't broken. Old malzahar was also broken, reverting him isn't going to fix a lot of things.

> [{quoted}](name=XTRMN00B1337,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=XVbxGRNH,comment-id=000100010000,timestamp=2017-04-22T19:44:45.983+0000)
>
> I never said current malz isn't broken. Old malzahar was also broken, reverting him isn't going to fix a lot of things.

It will make him fun to play, which is the only thing that matters.
So fix aids by giving cancer...?

> [{quoted}](name=XTRMN00B1337,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=XVbxGRNH,comment-id=00010001000000010000,timestamp=2017-04-22T22:12:14.613+0000)
>
> So fix aids by giving cancer...?

He'd be indestructible.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aI0euMFAWF8

Please tell me, exactly what about < 5% play rate for almost 4 years is "cancer".

Hell even his win rate was only around 52%. It's better than fucking lee.
Winrates and playrates don't make a champion cancer or not.

Well cancer is a pejorative, so how would you define "cancer"?

I'd personally define it as the traits of "growing" and "overly influential"... two things that pre-rework malzahar was not. 
Two things which champions like lee sin and yasuo undeniably are.

I don't know what you are trying to say with ''growing".

prerework malzahar could make his entire kit have 0 counterplay by pressing R, and good lord, R used to deal so much more damage too. Riot didn't solve the problem by loading R's damage potential into W, but there is a little more counterplay now.

Overinfluential only means OP at best. Also you say old mazlahar is fine because he had a 52% winrate, but that is good and above average, but lee sin only has 50%. So either you're hypocritical or you only quote stats that support your case.

Growing in respect to popularity. After all, cancer grows uncontrolled.

Pre-rework malz had just as much counterplay as the current version, the only difference was that it wasn't dependent on another ability to deal damage. This could've been solved by lowering it's damage. 

Win rate by no means directly translate to influence. A champion can have < 1% play rate, and a 70% win rate (dedicate mains man), but they'd have less influence over the game than a champion with 40% play rate and a 40% win rate.
old malz wasnt broken he was kinda annoying to play against but not as annoying as he is now

Old malz had flash QWER
It would either earn him a kill or he would die
There was actually nothing else to his kit

In a vacuum 1v1 situation sure.

However, beyond the early game, you've normally got an ally within reach, and malz locks himself down as much as he locks his target down with his ult.

But, i'll give you the benefit of the doubt, and say it's like that all game. Then why was malzahar in need of a rework come MYMU, but {{champion:1}} {{champion:127}} {{champion:112}} {{champion:134}} weren't?

Literally no one complained about this combo, until riot said they wanted to address it in the rework.

Literally one champion you listed typically flashes and throws down the entire kit and that's Annie.
Lissandra has an E to get in and show where she's going.
Viktor might be closer but generally plays around with his lasers to poke the enemy down.
Syndra is intended to throw a ball and then E it to stun someone before heading up to ult them.

All of these champions have the capability to preform this exact play pattern, just because they have other ones doesn't mean they don't do it.

Lis flash, ult, Q, W, E is a very common combo.
Viktor flash, Q, R, E, auto is just as strong, if not better, than annie's combo
Syndra flash, Q, E, W, R. You're dead. It's that simple. She didn't even have to hit you with the initial Q either.

See, literally all of these champions (and more, but these were the first i thought of) typically do this flash ulti for a free kill combo. Annie is just popularized because it's so much more common on her than the others, not because it's more powerful, but because she lacks other mechanics which they have, not forcing them to use the combo.

Lis has her E (as you stated), and the ability to defensively R.
Vik has his W to zone, and E for long range poke.
Syn has her her Q + E, to long range initiate, but more importantly her Q, W, and E can all be cast while moving.

> [{quoted}](name=XTRMN00B1337,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=XVbxGRNH,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2017-04-22T19:08:01.260+0000)

> Riot only reverts reworks if the old champion was healthy. This isn't malzahar's case.

Have they ever reverted a rework?

I don't recall.
Kog'maw.
Was Kog'Maw a partial revert or full revert?
Partial.

{{champion:143}} :'(

Her passive and maybe low base move speed were the only things amiss in her old kit. Now days it doesn't even really matter if you land your spells on enemy champs. I miss her hybrid mage/controller kit.
"Healthy" is my favourite buzzword thrown around here btw
Well, solid argument m9. I never defined the word, but I'm simply saying riot only reverts if the prereworked champion wasn't an issue. And nope that was not old malz.

Toxic. Binary. Counterplay. Agency. Healthy.

Daily does of Riot Games Buzzword cultivation. Enjoy.

I'm seeing all these "Malzahar's kit is pretty much the same" comments and I'm like:

 - Unwanted shield that promotes forgiveness of bad positioning that has been nerfed into the fucking dirt to the point where it doesn't even guarantee a single second of Nether Grasp because it only lasts .25 seconds... **WHICH WAS THEIR WHOLE POINT OF ADDING IT IN THE FIRST PLACE... RIP**.


 - Current Call of the Void inherently goes against Malzahar's immobile nature because as a spell with delay (Now in spell cast), it basically had more range when enemies were moving towards you and less range when moving away.  The whole "gotta wait a few seconds to cast Q to reset E" has resulted in a spell where instead of nuking people who dare enter your space, you are now trying to chase them as they run away and hopefully reset your Q so that your E doesn't just "tickle" them.


 - Current Voidlings have been nerfed to the point of uselessness **UNLESS** someone (i.e. Malzahar himself) tanks damage for them... Yea... uhum... 10/10 best design.... so wonderful.  Anyways... There is also the fact that people keep saying Voidlings are easier to control now... when they have the same priorities as before except... Directing them with auto attacks when E was not in effect was taken away and the leash was taken away (Which allowed you to pull back your Voidlings before they died and gave money to the enemy)... But its apparently easier to control them now according to the community right?


 - Malefic Visions for one does less damage, so its a weak spell on its own.  Secondly as stated before for Call of the Void, its reset function caused a weird kit that forces you to chase after people as an immobile champion in order to maximize your damage output.  Thirdly (A more minor issue) it does not give back flat amount of mana per bounce anymore and instead returns 2% of your max mana per bounce.  Old E got to rank 5 at level 9 and gave back 26 mana.  New E won't give you back that amount until level 15 assuming you had bought a Morellonomicon by then.  However if you don't get a mana item at all, Malzahar will only return 21-22 mana per bounce... at level 18 >_>


 - Old pool could be placed anywhere, anytime, for whatever you needed it for.  New pool can only be placed where an enemy targeted by your ult is.  Nuff Said.


 - And finally... Nether Grasp **lost its flat damage** which used to deal death to assassins or other squishies that dived the backline because he used to be anti-assassin/anti-dive.  Now his kit makes him assassin-proof (Not 100% guaranteed).  Anti-Assassin =/= Assassin-Proof.  It also makes it so that QSS now completely negates its damage by allowing people to walk off the pool rather than taking flat damage through the tether.


 - Bonus gripes go to:
    - Base armor reduced by 2
    - Movement speed reduced by 5
    - Auto Attack Range reduced by 50

---

I honestly don't know how people see these differences and justify trying to say his kit is the same. **(Screams internally)**

Agree completely.  

Riot basically redesigned a kit for what they claim was an "unhealthy" original design, but the redesign was so binary that it was either destined to be completely overpowered and oppressive or utterly useless and not at all fun to play.
inb4 sejuani rework ^^

Dont forget that the reduced mana costs coupled with the lesser impact of the E mana return (plus a whole lot of changes like faster Q and actual afk farming) destroyed his skillfloor and made him mega uber easy to play, compared to the niche 2% pickrate champion that existed for several years, which is also mainly why he became this broken abomination.

And all those gutted bases and ratios? He lost his anti-assassin niche completly when he lost his damage and the ability to build kinda tanky with RoA/Rylai/Liandri's. Now he is shoehorned into building glass AP, despite not being designed for that.

I mean, in some ways, it's correct to say his kit is the same. 
The surface level mechanics of the abilities really haven't changed much, and it's the kind of thing that I would expect players who never played the champion to think is equal. Just how like the rework was the kind of rework i'd expect to see from someone who had never touched the champion prior to being told they'd be reworking them.

That said, the biggest difference is that, while his basic mechanics haven't changed, all they really accomplished with the rework was to make it more simplistic for the malzahar player by removing their agency. 
No longer does the player have control over how much damage they will do, instead it's all been shifted to the W, which is basically just a fire and forget weapon. 
On top of that, they added basically no real value to his kit with the passive (even before all the nerfs), they just took the voidling blocking mechanic which skilled players could take advantage of and made it available to people of any experience or skill level.

I've used this analogy before, but this is actually what the malzahar rework was like. They took a car, broke it down into pieces, then reassembled it as a boat, added in a few necessary pieces, then held it all together with duct tap to make it functional.

The reason the only meaningful nerfs have been to his passive and W, is because those were the new pieces which they added, and they are literally carrying the rest of the, now useless, kit.
I like the {{champion:90}}  update, I haven't seen any issue with it.
He doesn't fit the identity he should. His power is all in voidlings now.
And the voidlings horribly shitty compared too his old ones for anyone who ever played AD Malz.
